contentrichtext.text: {{about|the Soyuz 27 spacecraft|the crew launched in Soyuz 27|Salyut 6 EP-1}} {{Infobox spaceflight | name = Soyuz 27 | image = | image_caption = | insignia = | mission_type = | operator = | COSPAR_ID = | SATCAT = | mission_duration = 64 days, 22 hours, 52 minutes, 47 seconds | distance_travelled = | orbits_completed = 1,025 | spacecraft = | spacecraft_type = [[Soyuz 7K-T]] | manufacturer = [[NPO Energia]] | launch_mass = {{convert|6800|kg|lb}} | landing_mass = | launch_date = {{start-date|January 10, 1978, 12:26:00|timezone=yes}} UTC | launch_rocket = [[Soyuz-U]] | launch_site = [[Baikonur Cosmodrome|Baikonur]] [[Baikonur Cosmodrome Site 1|1/5]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.astronautix.com/sites/baiurlc1.htm |title=Baikonur LC1 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |publisher=Encyclopedia Astronautica}}</ref> | landing_date = {{end-date|March 16, 1978, 11:18:47|timezone=yes}} UTC | landing_site = {{convert|310|km|mi}} W of Tselinograd | crew_size = 2 | crew_launching = [[Vladimir Dzhanibekov]]<br/>[[Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov|Oleg Makarov]] | crew_landing = [[Yuri Romanenko]]<br/>[[Georgi Grechko]] | crew_callsign = {{lang|ru|Памир}} ({{lang|ru-Latn|''Pamir''}} - "[[Pamir Mountains]]") | crew_photo = | crew_photo_caption = | orbit_epoch = | orbit_reference = [[Geocentric orbit|Geocentric]] | orbit_regime = [[Low Earth orbit|Low Earth]] | orbit_periapsis = {{convert|198.9|km|mi}} | orbit_apoapsis = {{convert|253.8|km|mi}} | orbit_inclination = 51.65 degrees | orbit_period = 88.73 minutes | apsis = gee | docking = {{Infobox spaceflight/Dock | docking_target = [[Salyut 6]] | docking_type = dock | docking_port = | docking_date = | undocking_date = | time_docked = }} | previous_mission = [[Soyuz 26]] | next_mission = [[Soyuz 28]] | programme = [[Soyuz programme]]<br/><small>(Manned missions)</small> }} '''Soyuz 27''' ({{lang-ru|'''Союз 27'''}}, ''Union 27'') was a 1978 [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] manned spacecraft which flew to the orbiting [[Salyut 6]] space station, during the mission [[Salyut 6 EP-1|EP-1]].<ref>The mission report is available here: http://www.spacefacts.de/mission/english/soyuz-27.htm</ref> It was the third manned flight to the station, and the second successful docking. Once docked, it marked the first time that three spacecraft were docked together. The main function of the EP-1 mission was to swap Soyuz craft with the orbiting crew, in so doing freeing a docking port for a forthcoming supply tanker. [[Cosmonauts]] [[Vladimir Dzhanibekov]] and [[Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov|Oleg Makarov]] returned to earth in the [[Soyuz 26]] spacecraft after spending five days on the station. ==Crew== {{Spaceflight crew |terminology = Cosmonaut |position1 = Commander |crew1_up = [[Vladimir Dzhanibekov]] |flights1_up = First |expedition1_up = [[Salyut 6 EP-1|EP-1]] |crew1_down = [[Yuri Romanenko]] |flights1_down = First |expedition1_down = [[Salyut 6 EO-1|EO-1]] |position2 = Flight Engineer |crew2_up = [[Oleg Grigoryevich Makarov|Oleg Makarov]] |flights2_up = Third |expedition2_up = [[Salyut 6 EP-1|EP-1]] |crew2_down = [[Georgi Grechko]] |flights2_down = Second |expedition2_down = [[Salyut 6 EO-1|EO-1]] }} ===Backup crew=== {{Spaceflight crew |terminology = Cosmonaut |position1 = Commander |crew1_up = [[Vladimir Kovalyonok]] |position2 = Flight Engineer |crew2_up = [[Aleksandr Ivanchenkov]] |notes = The launching and landing crews had the same backups }} ==Mission parameters== *'''Mass:''' {{convert|6800|kg|lb|abbr=on}} *'''Perigee:''' {{convert|198.9|km|mi|abbr=on}} *'''Apogee:''' {{convert|253.8|km|mi|abbr=on}} *'''Inclination:''' 51.65° *'''Period:''' 88.73 minutes == External links == *http://www.astronautix.com/flights/soyuz27.htm *http://www.spacefacts.de/mission/english/soyuz-27.htm *http://www.terra.es/personal/heimdall/eng/soyuz27.htm *http://www.zarya.info/Diaries/Salyut6/Occupation1.htm *http://books.nap.edu/books/0309085489/html/index.html ==References== {{reflist}} {{Soyuz}} [[Category:Manned Soyuz missions]] [[Category:1978 in spaceflight]] [[Category:1978 in the Soviet Union]]
